definition[0]: to run or drive into something very hard
example[0]: In the latest raid, thieves used his van to ram a police car.
example[1]: He lost control of his truck and rammed into a van, killing two people.
definition[1]: to push something into a position, using great force
example[2]: First, youâ€™ll have to ram the posts into the ground.
example[3]: I rammed my foot down on the brake.
definition[4]: a machine that hits something again and again to force it into a position
definition[5]: the part of a computer that acts as a temporary store for information so that it can be used immediately
example[4]: a model with 128 MB of RAM
definition[6]: random access memory; the memory in a computer system that is used to store information for a short time. The more RAM a computer has, the more software can be used on it at the same time
example[5]: Programs are getting bigger, requiring more RAM.
example[6]: The Marixx DS comes with 64 Megabytes of RAM.
